sen.j: 山崎 宗鑑（やまざき そうかん、寛正6年（1465年）? - 天文 (元号)22年10月2日 (旧暦)（1553年）?）は、戦国時代 (日本)の連歌師・俳諧作者。
sen.e: Sokan YAMAZAKI (1465?-August, 15, 1553) was a Japanese renga poet (linked-verse poet) and Haikai (seventeen-syllable verse) poet in the Sengoku Period.
sen.cmt: 10月2日:新暦変換済み
sen.e: Sokan YAMAZAKI (1465? -August, 15, 1553) was a Japanese Renga (Japanese collaborative poetry) poet and Haikairenga (humorous or vulgar Renga) poet in the Sengoku Period.
sen.cmt: 1465? の後にスペースを入れ， and Haikai の間のダブルスペースを訂正しました。用語集の連歌の説明がわかりづらいと考え変更しました。俳諧の正式名は俳諧連歌で，後列に俳諧連歌と使われるため，混乱を避ける目的で以後俳諧連歌として訳しました。
sen.e: Sokan YAMAZAKI (1465? -November, 17, 1553) was a Japanese Renga (Japanese collaborative poetry) poet and Haikairenga (humorous or vulgar Renga) poet in the Sengoku Period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 本名を志那範重、通称を弥三郎と称し、近江国の出身とされる。
sen.e: Although it is said that his real name was Norishige SHINA, that his common name was Yasaburo, and that he was from Omi Province, there are various theories about his real name and his birth place and none of them has been confirmed.
It is believed that his real name was Norishige SHINA, as well as his common name was Yasaburo, and that his birthplace was Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。文体を統一するために近江国出身の表現を変更しました。
sen.e: It is believed that his real name was Norishige SHINA, as well as his common name was Yasaburo, and that his birthplace was Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし本名・出自については諸説あり定かではない。
sen.e: However, there are various theories about his real name and birthplace--none of them has been confirmed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, there are various theories about his real name and birthplace--none of them has been confirmed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 室町幕府9代征夷大将軍足利義尚に仕えた（近習とも祐筆とも）が、義尚の陣没（延徳元年、1489年）後出家し、摂津国尼崎または山城国薪村に隠棲した。
sen.e: Although ha had served Yoshinao ASHIKAGA, the ninth Seitaishogun ((literally, "great general who subdues the eastern barbarians") (as kinju (attendant) or yuhitsu (private secretary)) in the Muromachi Period, he became a priest after Yoshinao died in the war camp (in 1489) and retreated into seclusion in Amagasaki of Settsu Province or Takigi-mura Village of Yamashiro Province and later, he made a thatched hut named "Taigetsu-an" for his seclusion in Yamazaki of Yamashiro Province (Settsu Province?) and was called Sokan YAMAZAKI..

Although he had served (as kinju [attendant] or yuhitsu [private secretary]) Yoshinao ASHIKAGA, the ninth Seitaishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the eastern barbarians") in the Muromachi Period, he became a priest after Yoshinao died in battle (in 1489) and led a secluded life in Amagasaki of Settsu Province and Takigi-mura Village of Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。he にスペルミスがあります。()内の（）を[]に変更しました。（近習とも祐筆とも）の位置を移動，隠棲の訳に類似の単語が重なっているので変更しました。陣没は戦死と考え変更しました。
sen.e: Although he had served (as kinju [attendant] or yuhitsu [private secretary]) Yoshinao ASHIKAGA, the ninth Seitaishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the eastern barbarians") in the Muromachi Period, he became a priest after Yoshinao died in battle (in 1489) and led a secluded life in Amagasaki of Settsu Province and Takigi-mura Village of Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後淀川河畔の山城国（摂津国？）山崎に庵「對月庵」を結び、山崎宗鑑と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Afterward, he lived in a hermitage 'Taigetsu-an' in Yamazaki of Yamashiro Province (or Settsu Province?) and was called Sokan YAMAZAKI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。庵を結ぶの訳を変更，「・・」なので'・・'に修正しました。
sen.e: Afterward, he lived in a hermitage 'Taigetsu-an' in Yamazaki of Yamashiro Province (or Settsu Province?) and was called Sokan YAMAZAKI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 現在大阪府島本町山崎に「宗鑑井戸」「宗鑑旧居跡」が残されている。
sen.e: The ruins of Sokan's old house (Sokan-ido or Sokan-well) remain in Yamazaki, Shimamoto-cho, Osaka Prefecture.
Sokan-ido' (Sokan-well) and 'the ruins of Sokan's old house' remain in Yamazaki, Shimamoto-cho, Osaka Prefecture at present.
sen.cmt: 「宗鑑井戸」「宗鑑旧居跡」は用語集でもthe ruins of Sokan's old house (Sokan-ido or Sokan-well)となっていますが，別物と考え分けて訳しました。訳漏れありです。
sen.e: Sokan-ido' (Sokan-well) and 'the ruins of Sokan's old house' remain in Yamazaki, Shimamoto-cho, Osaka Prefecture at present.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大永3年(1523年)ごろ山崎の地を去り、享禄元年(1528年)に讃岐国（香川県観音寺市）の興昌寺に庵「一夜庵」を結びそこで生涯を終えた。
sen.e: Sokan left his place of Yamazaki around 1523 and made another thatched hut named "Ichiya-an" at Kosho-ji Temple in Sanuki Province (currently Kannonji City, Kagawa Prefecture) in 1528 and ended his life there.

After leaving Yamazaki around 1523, Sokan had lived in another hermitage 'Ichiya-an' within the precincts of Kosho-ji Temple in Sanuki Province (currently Kannonji City, Kagawa Prefecture) since 1528, where he ended his life.
sen.cmt: 「一夜庵」に住んだのは1528年から生涯を終えるまで・・と考えるとsinceを使う必要が在ると考え，また庵は寺の敷地内と考え，書き直しました。また「一夜庵」なので'Ichiya-an'に修正しました。
sen.e: After leaving Yamazaki around 1523, Sokan had lived in another hermitage 'Ichiya-an' within the precincts of Kosho-ji Temple in Sanuki Province (currently Kannonji City, Kagawa Prefecture) since 1528, where he ended his life.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 「一夜庵」の名は宗鑑が長居の客を厭い一夜以上の宿泊を断ったからという。
sen.e: It is said that the hut was named "Ichiya-an" (literally meaning a hut for one-night stay) because Sokan did not want guests to stay there long and used to refuse stays of two or more nights and the hut, which went through many repairs, has survived to remain at the original place.

The name of the hermitage 'Ichiya-an' (literally meaning a hermitage for one-night stay) seemingly originates in the fact that Sokan, who avoided people staying too long, forbade people from staying two days or more.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。文が多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: The name of the hermitage 'Ichiya-an' (literally meaning a hermitage for one-night stay) seemingly originates in the fact that Sokan, who avoided people staying too long, forbade people from staying two days or more.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 建物は修復を重ねながら現地に残されている。
sen.e: Repeated repairs have enabled the structure to remain at original site.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Repeated repairs have enabled the structure to remain at original site.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 宗祇・宗長・荒木田守武などと交流し俳諧連歌を興隆した。
sen.e: Sokan socialized with Sogi, Socho, Moritake ARAKIDA and others and contributed to prosperity of Haikairenga (a type of Renga).
Socializing with Sogi, Socho, Moritake ARAKIDA and others, Sokan contributed to the prosperity of Haikairenga.
sen.cmt: 文が多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。 'prosperity' に冠詞を加えました。
sen.e: Socializing with Sogi, Socho, Moritake ARAKIDA and others, Sokan contributed to the prosperity of Haikairenga.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 宗鑑の連歌作品として伝わるものはわずかであるが、俳諧連歌のもっとも早い時期に編纂された俳諧撰集「犬筑波集」がある。
sen.e: Although there are a very few renga products attributed to Sokan, the anthology of haikai poems "Inu Tsukubashu", compiled the earliest in the time of haikai renga, with its vulgar and bold style, had influence on haikai poems of the Danrin school in the early Edo Period.
Although only a few Renga attributed to Sokan remain, the anthology of Haikairenga "Inu Tsukubashu," compiled in the earliest stage of the prevalence of Haikairenga, introduces Sokan's masterpieces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。文が多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。「俳諧連歌のもっとも早い時期に」の意味するところを考え言葉を補いました。
sen.e: Although only a few Renga attributed to Sokan remain, the anthology of Haikairenga "Inu Tsukubashu," compiled in the earliest stage of the prevalence of Haikairenga, introduces Sokan's masterpieces.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その卑俗奔放な句風は、江戸時代初期の談林俳諧に影響を与えた。
sen.e: Their verse style with coarseness and boldness influenced Danrin Haikai (Haikairenga of the Danrin-ha school) in the early Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Their verse style with coarseness and boldness influenced Danrin Haikai (Haikairenga of the Danrin-ha school) in the early Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、荒木田守武とともに、俳諧の祖と称される。
sen.e: Together with Moritake ARAKIDA, Sokan is regarded as the founder of haikai.
Together with Moritake ARAKIDA, Sokan is regarded as the founder of Haikairenga.
sen.cmt: 俳諧を頭文字を大文字で統一しました。
sen.e: Together with Moritake ARAKIDA, Sokan is regarded as the founder of Haikairenga.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 能筆家としても有名で生計は書を売ることによって立てていたとも伝わる。
sen.e: Sokan was also famous as a distinguished calligrapher and it is said that he made his living by selling his calligraphic works.
Sokan was also so famous as a distinguished calligrapher that he is said to have made his living by selling his calligraphic works.
sen.cmt: 文が多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: Sokan was also so famous as a distinguished calligrapher that he is said to have made his living by selling his calligraphic works.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 晩年「ヨウ（できもの）」を患いそのために命を失うことになる。
sen.e: He suffered from "yo" (boils) in his late years, which deprived him of his life.
He suffered from 'yo' (boil) in his late years, which deprived him of his life.
sen.cmt: 「ヨウ」なので'yo'に修正しました。'boil' は単数でよいと思われます。
sen.e: He suffered from 'yo' (boil) in his late years, which deprived him of his life.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: したがって辞世は「宗鑑はいづくへと人の問うならば ちとよう（ヨウ）がありてあの世へといへ」。
sen.e: Thus, his death poem was "if someone asks where Sokan is going, tell him Sokan is going to the other world for "yo". ("yo" meaning "business" is used as a pun here)
Thus, his farewell poetry was 'If someone ask you where Sokan is, please tell him or her Sokan is in the other world for "yo" ("yo" meaning "business" is used as a pun here).'
sen.cmt: 辞世の句の表現を変更，句の先頭文字を大文字に，多少言葉を補い変更しました。「・・」なので'・・'に修正しました。
sen.e: Thus, his farewell poetry was 'If someone ask you where Sokan is, please tell him or her Sokan is in the other world for "yo" ("yo" meaning "business" is used as a pun here).'
sen.cmt: 修正なし
